name: Ethnographic and Qualitative Research Conference
content: The Ethnographic and Qualitative Research Conference (EQRC) holds an annual conference that brings together scholars from around the U.S. and abroad in order to present scholarship related to a wide variety of contexts, including theory, practice, qualitative research, and conceptual advancement. It is a juried conference, meaning that presentation proposals undergo peer-review prior to potential acceptance for presentation. We are in the 28th annual year and expect a robust conference with ample opportunities to exchange theoretical ideas, share research results, help advance practice, make collaborative connections, and learn from one anotherâ€™s scholarship.
